description: A montage of party scenes shows a young man being touched by several provocatively dressed women, followed by a wide shot of a crowded, energetic nightclub. The narration describes the film as a raunchy European travel comedy.

A black screen with a "CC" logo appears. A Korean narrator explains that the video uses YouTube captions and instructs viewers on how to enable them if they are not visible.
A black screen with the white text "#1. movie start" is shown, serving as a chapter marker for the beginning of the film scene.
The scene shows a high school graduation ceremony. Cheerful graduates in red gowns run out of the school building, celebrating. The narrator introduces the main character, Scott Thomas.
At the high school graduation, Scott Thomas shares a celebratory and romantic kiss with his girlfriend, Fiona, while his friend Cooper looks on.
Immediately after their celebratory kiss, Scott attempts to talk about the future, but his girlfriend Fiona abruptly informs him that she is breaking up with him.
At the exact moment Scott is being dumped, his family arrives to take a graduation photo, capturing his shocked expression next to his smiling now-ex-girlfriend.
At a high school graduation ceremony, a young woman named Fiona breaks up with her boyfriend, Scottie, telling him he is too predictable before walking away from him.
A distraught Scottie yells his ex-girlfriend Fiona's name in a crowd of graduates, a moment which is being recorded on a home video camera.
In a bedroom, Scottie's friends and younger brother repeatedly watch and laugh at the embarrassing home video of him yelling for Fiona after being dumped.
While still upset about his breakup, Scottie receives an email on his computer from his German pen pal, Mieke. He uses a German dictionary to understand and reply to the email.

sensitive_score.explanation: A character jokingly suggests another character will be sexually assaulted ('raped') by his online pen pal. The comment is brief, not graphic, and presented in a comedic context.
The conversation involves a joke about sexual assault, which could be considered controversial.

description: Scottie's friend, Cooper, misunderstands that the German pen pal Mieke is a man named Mike. He comically warns Scottie that online pen pals are often predators and jokes that "Mike" will try to meet up and sexually assault him, a comment that justifies a low sexual content score.
A wide shot shows a lively graduation party taking place at night in the backyard of a house, filled with guests, a pool, and festive decorations.
At the party, Scottie and Cooper interact with their friends, the twins Jenny and Jamie. They have a friendly, casual conversation, treating Jenny as one of their male friends.

A young man named Scotty enters his messy bedroom and sits at his computer. He reads an email written entirely in German, looking confused by its content.
Scotty, confused by a German word in the email, looks it up in a dictionary. He finds it means 'to arrange a meeting' but misinterprets it as a sexual advance, reacting with shock and anger.

sensitive_score.explanation: The character types the mildly offensive phrase 'sick German freak' in an email. It's an insult based on nationality but delivered in a comedic, non-hateful context.

description: Acting on his misunderstanding, Scotty angrily types a reply calling the sender a 'sick German freak.' He tells them to never write to him again before slamming his laptop shut.

description: The next morning, Scotty wakes up in bed with a severe hangover. He groans in pain and mutters, 'I'm never drinking again,' expressing his regret.

Scotty's younger brother, Bert, who has read the email, tells him that 'Mieke' wants to hook up. Scotty dismisses this, believing 'Mike' is a man based on a photo. Bert corrects him, explaining that Mieke is a German girl's name.
Scotty has a moment of shocking realization about his mistake. A narrator explains the linguistic error, using the German word 'Ja' (yes) to illustrate how pronunciation differs from English.
After a few more examples of German pronunciation, the full weight of his mistake hits Scotty. He lets out a prolonged, horrified scream and falls backward onto his bed in despair.

A young child draws a mustache on himself that is clearly intended to resemble that of Adolf Hitler. While presented humorously, this imagery is associated with a highly controversial and sensitive historical figure.

description: While adults converse in the living room, a young boy draws a mustache on his upper lip with a marker, creating a likeness of Adolf Hitler. He then turns and smiles. This use of controversial imagery, though in a comedic context, warrants a moderate controversy score.

description: To fund their continued journey, one of the friends makes a sacrifice. A stack of Euro banknotes is shown, followed by a conversation where he reveals he has sold his camera to get the necessary money.

sensitive_score.explanation: A brief flashback shows a man being robbed at knifepoint. The scene includes a weapon being used to threaten someone, justifying a low violence score.

description: A Korean-language narration explains a past event, accompanied by a brief flashback where a man is robbed at knifepoint on a dark street. The scene then transitions to a group of friends reuniting and a graphic showing a plane's flight path, indicating the start of a journey.

sensitive_score.explanation: Vatican Swiss Guards cross their halberds (a type of pole weapon) to block a character from entering. This is a non-violent use of a weapon for security purposes.

description: At the entrance to a Vatican museum, tourists walk past uniformed Swiss Guards. One of the main characters attempts to run inside but is stopped when the guards cross their ceremonial halberds to block his path.
Inside the museum, a tour guide leads a group of young people up a grand, ornate staircase, passing by statues and elaborate lamp posts. The scene depicts a typical museum tour.
A montage shows the group of friends walking through the museum's galleries, looking at various paintings and sculptures. The focus is on their exploration of the historical art and architecture.

sensitive_score.explanation: A character pulls a bell rope that is meant to be rung only upon the death of the Pope. This act involves the misuse of a significant religious artifact for comedic effect.

description: A tour guide explains that a decorative bell rope is used to signal the death of the Pope. Out of curiosity, one of the characters pulls the rope, setting off an unexpected chain of events.

sensitive_score.explanation: The scene depicts a false alarm about the Pope's death, causing mass panic in St. Peter's Square and a media frenzy. This use of a major religious figure's supposed death as a comedic plot point is a sensitive topic.

description: A giant bell begins to toll, causing the crowd in the square outside to believe the Pope has died. People react with shock and panic, a news reporter starts broadcasting, and chaos ensues due to the misunderstanding.

Amid the chaotic crowd in St. Peter's Square, the main male character spots the woman he has been searching for. He immediately starts running and pushing his way through the dense crowd to get to her.

sensitive_score.explanation: A group of soccer hooligans physically intervenes to stop the Swiss Guards from making an arrest. This involves aggressive shoving and a physical confrontation, representing a low level of violence.
The scene depicts a physical altercation with and open disrespect for the Vatican's official guard force in a sacred location.

description: As the Swiss Guards attempt to arrest the main characters, a group of aggressive soccer hooligans confronts the guards. The hooligans shout at and physically push the guards away, allowing the main characters to escape.

The main character finally reaches the woman in the middle of the crowded square, and they face each other. To his shock, she asks, "Who are you?", revealing she doesn't know him. The entire embarrassing moment is broadcast on live television.
A black screen appears with the white text "# 2. epilogue," serving as a title card to transition to the final segment of the film.

description: This scene is a montage of clips that the narrator warns contain nudity. It shows a man in a hot tub with a topless woman, whose nudity is partially obscured. Another clip shows a woman in a red latex outfit. The scene then transitions to characters checking in at an airport and flying on an airplane. The sexual content score is elevated due to the presence of partial nudity and the narrator's direct warning about the movie's explicit content.
